intro: Fagonia flamandii, commonly known as the Canary Islands fagonia, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and fleshy, spiny leaves. The plant is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its succulent structure. It produces small, red or orange fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Fagonia flamandii is an important component of the local flora, contributing to the unique biodiversity of the region.
